description:
Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with 278 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Role

The Production Finance Operations and Innovation (O&I) Coordinator will play a critical role in supporting the PF O&I team across a range of workflow and data-related projects. The ideal candidate will have a background in Production Finance or Production Accounting, a passion for driving innovation, identifying workflow efficiencies, and a demonstrated interest in data.

This position requires the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment, supporting multiple projects globally.

Responsibilities

Production Finance Workflows and support

  • Track group projects through completion
  • Ensure that project needs are met timely and help identify areas for operational improvements
  • Collaborate with a wide variety of cross-functional partners including other Finance teams, Labor, Production Management, Tech partners, and many more
  • Facilitate broad communications to the Production Finance team in order to socialize business updates and collect key deliverables for business partners (Internal Audit, Treasury, and Risk Assurance, etc)

Data related

  • Support projects related to data analytics
  • Consolidate and maintain key data points for future reference (i.e. model assumptions, crew counts, sample shows, etc)
  • Conduct data quality assurance testing, identifying and resolving any issues with data accuracy and completeness

Payroll related

  • Manage the collection of digital start paperwork updates across several business teams
  • Collaborate with payroll partners to ensure start packets are updated timely
  • Gather and organize workflow and payroll partner feedback from members of the Production Finance team
  • Pull payroll reports using payroll company tools

Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in finance, business administration, entertainment, or data related fields helpful but not required
  • 2+ years of experience in Production Finance, Production Accounting, or other Entertainment Industry areas preferred

Skills And Abilities

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Basic knowledge of SQL or an interest in learning
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders and global teams
  • Excellent project management skills, capable of managing multiple projects
  • Ability to adapt to changing priorities throughout the day
  • Detail-oriented but also interested in understanding the bigger picture

Personal Attributes

  • Innovative and creative problem-solving mindset
  • Flexible, open to different perspectives, and thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly organized and self-motivated, with a strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • High standards of integrity and ethics
  • Collaborative team player who is comfortable escalating issues or seeking help when needed
  • Curious and results-focused

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000-240,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
